p: Streptococcus pneumoniae, Staphylococcus aureus, and Haemophilus influenzae may asymptomatically colonize the upper respiratory tract and are the etiologic agents of acute otitis media, sinusitis, and pneumonia. S. pneumoniae is also responsible for bacterial meningitis [ 1, 2]. Nowadays, the treatment of these diseases is threatened by the development of antibiotic resistance worldwide [ 3]. Essential oils (EOs) and their isolated compounds have been shown to possess antimicrobial activity against several pathogens [ 4]. The complex mixtures that generally constitute EOs can be advantageous because pathogens have difficulty in displaying resistance mechanisms to the multiple constituents of essential oils [ 5, 6].
